page.title: 01SOUTH-WEST TELFORD
page.content: The area we have covered is very mixed in character.Our area is traditionally an industrial and agricultural one, Telford being described as the "birthplace of the industrial revolution".There are remnants of the old mining and smelting industries still to be found,such as the old Court Works in Madeley,and agricultural land is also in evidence. However,Telford is now a major growth area,and new housing is mushrooming in the area to accomodate the overspill population from Birmingham and other parts of the West Midlands.The area is now,therefore,predominantly a residential one,with vestiges of its old uses still in evidence.These stand side by side with new industries,which employ the recently-arrived workforce and are mainly in the engineering field.
